title: Warm Jackets for Rangpur
description: Rangpur, located in the northern region of Bangladesh, experiences some of the coldest temperatures in the country. Many residents, particularly children and elderly in rural areas, lack adequate winter clothing. This campaign seeks to collect and distribute warm jackets to families living in mud homes with poor insulation, who face extreme discomfort as temperatures drop during late December and January nights. Our volunteers will travel door-to-door to ensure direct delivery to the most vulnerable households.
volunteerSupport: 20 dedicated student volunteers from Begum Rokeya University

title: Blanket Drive in Sylhet
description: In the lush tea gardens of Sylhet, thousands of workers live in temporary shelters without insulation. As misty mornings turn colder, families—many with small children—struggle to stay warm. This campaign aims to deliver heavy blankets and essential winter bedding to over 300 households. Volunteers will coordinate with local tea garden authorities to ensure smooth, respectful, and culturally aware distribution. Blankets will be collected from across Sylhet city and surrounding unions.
goal: Collect and distribute 700 thick winter blankets by mid-December
volunteerSupport: 30 active volunteers from Shahjalal University of Science and Technology

title: Sweater Collection for Dhaka Slums
description: Dhaka’s slum residents, living in makeshift shelters near rail lines and under flyovers, endure frigid nights with limited protection. This campaign will collect gently used sweaters and distribute them in the Korail, Kallyanpur, and Sattola slums. Special focus is placed on collecting items for children aged 2–12, as they are the most vulnerable. Donations will be sorted, cleaned, and packed before being handed out at slum community centers.
volunteerSupport: 15 volunteers from BRAC University and NSU

title: Winter Help for Rajshahi Farmers
description: Rajshahi's early-morning fog and freezing dew put daily-wage farmers at risk of colds, joint pains, and other winter-related illnesses. These farmers start their day before sunrise with little more than a thin lungi and shirt. This campaign will equip them with thermal trousers, wool gloves, and hooded jackets. Local unions and madrasa students are partnering to identify eligible households and distribute aid on a rotational basis.
goal: Distribute 600+ winter kits to daily-wage farming families
volunteerSupport: 18 volunteers from local colleges and religious schools

title: Blanket Distribution in Khulna
description: Khulna’s coastal communities, exposed to chilling winds from the Bay of Bengal, often have no protection against the cold. Many live in bamboo or tin homes that offer no insulation. Our campaign targets these areas with waterproof blankets and thermal wear. Emergency kits will also include dry food, saline, and basic medicines, since the cold often triggers flu and dehydration in these vulnerable groups.
goal: Gather 800 donations by December for the coastal belt

title: Winter Relief for Chattogram Hills
description: Indigenous communities in the remote Chattogram Hill Tracts face unique challenges during winter. Many live hours from the nearest road, and winter aid rarely reaches them. This campaign will send warm clothes, babywear, and eco-friendly blankets to 400+ families. Transport will be arranged via local boats and four-wheel vehicles. Volunteers will camp overnight to reach far-flung homes and ensure each family is supported respectfully.
goal: Reach 400 remote families with 2 items each
volunteerSupport: 40 volunteers including scouts and Peace Corps trainees

title: Emergency Cold Kits for Mymensingh
description: With recurring fog and sudden cold waves, the impoverished regions of Mymensingh need emergency winter response. This campaign is focused on assembling cold-survival kits including blankets, cough syrup, Vaseline, and hot water flasks. Elderly citizens and newborns are our first priority. Medical volunteers will accompany clothing teams to assess those needing further health assistance.
goal: Provide 300 cold kits before the next cold wave hits

title: Thermal Support in Barisal Char Areas
description: Barisal’s char regions, surrounded by river networks, become dangerously cold during winter nights due to high humidity and open winds. Most char inhabitants sleep on the floor with minimal bedding. This campaign aims to provide insulated mats, thermal blankets, and winter pajamas for entire families. Boats will be used to transport supplies to remote islands, with special attention given to pregnant women and toddlers.
volunteerSupport: 20 student volunteers from Barisal BM College

title: Hilltop Warmth for Bandarban Schools
description: In Bandarban's hilltop schools, many students walk for miles barefoot in freezing temperatures. These children often arrive with little protection against the morning cold. This campaign targets school-aged children with school-friendly winter gear including shoes, sweaters, and full-sleeve uniforms. Teachers will help distribute the gear and monitor children's health through the season.
